title: Winter 2024 seasonal conditions | Managing crop pests

tasks.task: Conducting pest monitoring in a pulse crop field
subtasks: Look for aphid pests (green peach aphid, cabbage aphid)
Check for signs of natural enemy activity (parasitism, predation)
Decide whether intervention is needed based on assessment
Consider using soft chemicals (e.g., Pyramor, Transform) if necessary
Account for crop vigor in damage tolerance

tasks.task: Evaluating the impact of grazing on pest management
subtasks: Factor in residual pest populations after grazing
Regularly monitor crop for pest and beneficial insect activity
Use a systematic approach to monitoring
Consider the role of natural enemies (parasitic wasps, ladybeetles, hoverflies, lacewings)
Utilize resources for pest identification (e.g., PESFAX, Grow Notes)

tasks.task: Adapting management strategies based on crop variety
subtasks: Recognize that some varieties can outgrow aphid damage
Base intervention decisions on current crop growth stage and variety characteristics
